column8: text

survey by market research firm Kajidata Research found that only 6.5 per cent of the respondents could relate to the Islamist party, which they also felt was the most unlikely to win the next polls and develop the country.PAS also received the lowest support from Muslims and Malays, their key target communities. Only 9 per cent Muslims and 10 per cent Malays said they backed PAS.PAS was also the least trusted party to develop the country, with merely five per cent of those polled agreeing.DAP at 2.6 per cent, followed by Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (1.9 per cent), and Parti Amanah Negara (0.7 per cent).http://www.themalaymailonline.com/malaysia...qV8k0LqqdyLI.97

when see a malay name research company sure more malay interviewees. while an english name research company sure more english interviewees.one thing for sure those that took the survey are surely more educated. so hence the result. i bet if the interviewers would go walk about in areas where people are less educated and malay speaking, guaranteed the results will be different.
